title: (x) “The Island” movie poster - Century Gothic, Eurostile {Paul DH, Marc O}
content:
Could someone tell me what fonts are used on "The Island" movie poster? Both the title and the actors' names.

Thanks in advance.

comments.content: Eurostile. Thanks. One down, one to go.

ISLAND is a slightly stretched Century Gothic, with a customized A

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/bold/testdrive.html?s=I...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061016/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/bold/testdrive.html?s=ISLAND&p=60 "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/century-gothic/bold/testdrive.html?s=ISLAND&p=60")

Does anybody who saw the movie know the beautiful serif face they used for opening titles (names, etc)?

It's a really great movie, by the way, I loved it. And they shot parts of it a couple of blocks from me in downtown LA!
are there really any "great" hollywood movies these days?

Paul,

_Great_ is pretty relative... I didn't mean it is a masterpiece, but better than most movies that I watched in a couple of months.

Tarantino makes some pretty darn good movies, though, for a Hollywood director.
To answer my own question, I'm pretty sure they used Mrs Eaves throughout the movie. That nice uc R made the connection.
